item.title: Resume
item.description: EXPERIENCE Data Analyst: The Center for Collegiate Mental Health, August 2018 – present Maintained graduate research assistant responsibilities, while taking on ownership of data cleaning, standardization, and management. Created an R package to standardize R functions for internal use (https://github.com/CCMH-PSU/CCMHr). Graduate Research Assistant: The Center for Collegiate Mental Health, August 2014 – August 2018 Managed large databases of longitudinal psychotherapy data from 700,000+ clients and 200+ college counseling centers, including data merging and cleaning.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Lefevor, G. T., Jensen, D. R., Jones, P. J., Janis, R. A., & Hsieh, C. H. (2018). An Undergraduate Positive Psychology Course as Prevention and Outreach. Retrieved from osf.io/uj7na. Lefevor, G.T., Janis, R.A., Fraklin, A., Stone, & W.M. (in press). Initial distress and change through therapy among transgender and gender non-conforming racial and ethnic minorities. The Counseling Psychologist. Janis, R.A., Burlingame, G.M. & Olsen, J.A. (2018). Developing a therapeutic relationship monitoring system for group treatment.
